ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about German culture and new vocabulary as well.
I greatly improved my German skills, both my understanding and production of the language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think that the pace was too fast. We covered too many things at once and they were done on a more superficial level.

The textbook and the course are very interactive and fun. Our small size also made the class even more interactive, and I really enjoyed getting to know my classmates. I think sometimes some class periods are a little to fast-paced, and some book exercises are not too helpful, but these are very small issues in an overall incredible course!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes it is very useful for improvement of the German language. Also it is very interesting since the topics are very interesting.

I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who wants to improve their German skills. I think this is the first language course where you get to actually develop your own ideas and have discussions, which is incredibly helpful.
